title: Can I audition for YG if I am 24 years old? - Quora

response.answer_text: well, kpop idols usually train for years. as for yg… they’re known for the ‘dungeon’. they will train you for years and years and you’ll never know when you’ll debut. jennie trained for 7 years, jisoo + lisa for 5, rosé for 4. it’s also extremely hard to get into YG. for rosé it was a 700:1 and lisa was the only one who got into YG as a trainee. korea isn’t the best at accepting older kpop idols either. newly debuted idols are 16–20+ years old. i would say, if you think you have a lot of talent & potential, try out for a different company. YG is really hard to get into, and even if you get into YG, training years are long. and who knows? YG might kick you out for being too old! try for a company that is known for letting trainees debut 1–3 years after training. generally, i would say if you work very hard you can debut after 1–3 years. but even so, it’s a tough battle between you, and other young talented girls waiting to debut. so go for another company, but if u really want to try out for YG, go for it. smile, be nice, let your personality shine through, dance / sing / rap well, and i guess your safe ! good luck ! fighting ! ♡

I don’t know, YG will let u audition, but take into consideration that u r 24 years old, and if u get in you will train for lets assume, 5 years, meaning u will be about 29 when u debut, which is quite an old age to debut. So idk. :) -Minnie Park
